title: Eells–Kuiper manifold
summary: In mathematics, an Eells–Kuiper manifold is a compactification of R n {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{n}} by a sphere of dimension n / 2 {\displaystyle n/2} , where n = 2 , 4 , 8 {\displaystyle n=2,4,8} , or 16 {\displaystyle 16} . It is named after James Eells and Nicolaas Kuiper.
